instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V42_G3H: What is 3V42_G3H? This is shorthand for PP3V42_G3H which is one of the first power rails that must turn on in older Macbooks that use a magsafe charger in order for them to get a light on the charger. This power rail powers the onewire circuit and the SMC, which are necessary for the machine to communicate with the charger and get it to turn on, as well as begin the bootup sequence. .
definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.D7010: What is D7010? Diode between ground and gate of Q7010 on 2013-2015 year retina model macbook pros, necessary for Q7010 to allow PPDCIN_G3H to flow through to PP3V42_G3H power supply input. When this diode dies or corrodes, PP3V42_G3H input will not have any voltage, and chargers will not turn on. This can often be the problem if a system only works with a knockoff charger/bench power supply. .
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Charger Green/Orange - No Boot - No 12.5v
threads.message:
Hello,

The machine is a 2014 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2.8GHz 16GB DG.

There was liquid damage however the customer decided to wipe away the evidence before brining the laptop in.

I am getting 0.7v on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>

I am assuming that a short is causing this but can't see or feel anything hot.

Thanks!

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Charger Green/Orange - No Boot - No 12.5v
threads.message:
I hope you didn't inject voltage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> yet.
Post the exact diode mode (red probe at ground) on <SIGNAL>PPBBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.

Do you get <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>?
Post 820-xxxx code of your board.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Charger Green/Orange - No Boot - No 12.5v
threads.message:
Hi,

The Board code is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A

3.38v at <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>

-621 on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> in diode mode.

No voltage injected!

Thanks

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Charger Green/Orange - No Boot - No 12.5v
threads.message:
Post <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> voltages; pins 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.
Also post exact resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 (ohm scale).

BTW, your mainboard isn't <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>???

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Charger Green/Orange - No Boot - No 12.5v
threads.message: It is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, no idea how I managed to screw that one up.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Charger Green/Orange - No Boot - No 12.5v
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Charger Green/Orange - No Boot - No 12.5v
threads.message:
"27 - 0.13v"
Check <RESISTOR>R7120</RESISTOR>/21/22.
Post exact ohm resistance for <RESISTOR>R7185</RESISTOR>/86, measured onboard.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Charger Green/Orange - No Boot - No 12.5v
threads.message:
After connecting the machine to power again the CPU/Heatsink is getting pretty hot.

I measured the Pins again and have outlined the changes.

<CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> Voltages

Pin
1 - 0v
2 - 20.1v
3 - 4.66v
[B]9 - 0.23v[/B]
12 - 3.39v
13 - 3.08v
14 - 2.29v
15 - 0.04v
[B]17 - 2.46v[/B]
19 - 5.49v
20 - 5.49v
[B]27 - 19.9v[/B]

Shall I go ahead and provide the measurements you requested or does this change things?

Thanks

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Charger Green/Orange - No Boot - No 12.5v
threads.message:
Some things changed now.
All mentioned resistors should be good.

Post diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>; connect red probe to ground!

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Charger Green/Orange - No Boot - No 12.5v
threads.message:
Ok so things changed again, when I reconnected the genuine MagSafe 2 85w adapter there was no indicator light.

X3 chargers tested which work fine on other machines.

I am going to re-measure everything and provide again.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Charger Green/Orange - No Boot - No 12.5v
threads.message: Previous voltages have been measured with original charger?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Charger Green/Orange - No Boot - No 12.5v
threads.message:
Yep always original, no fakes here.

Have been looking at the onewire/adapter sense systems to work out what's preventing the charger light from coming on.

More than I bargained for...

I have a bunch of working boards to compare against.

<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, U7001and surrounding components seem good.

I am getting 1.7v on the <SIGNAL>PP20V_DCIN_FUSE</SIGNAL> but only 0.11v on <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL>

SMC?....

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Charger Green/Orange - No Boot - No 12.5v
threads.message:
" 2 - 20.1v
-------------------
I am getting 1.7v on the <SIGNAL>PP20V_DCIN_FUSE</SIGNAL>"
So, what happened???

Looks like charger detects leakage on the input stage.
Usually <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR>, or <DIODE>D7010</DIODE> problem.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Charger Green/Orange - No Boot - No 12.5v
threads.message:
I don't know what caused the extra challenge. It must have been me and a loose grounding wire to the multimeter, no one else to blame etc.

I have components to swap out.. but first

Getting the following in diode mode..

<SIGNAL>DCIN_ISOL_GATE_R</SIGNAL> to GND - 954
<SIGNAL>DCIN_ISOL</SIGNAL> to GND - 1012

On a good board I get

<SIGNAL>DCIN_ISOL_GATE_R</SIGNAL> to GND - No reading
<SIGNAL>DCIN_ISOL</SIGNAL> to GND - 1012

<CAPACITOR>C7012</CAPACITOR> or am I barking up the wrong tree?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Charger Green/Orange - No Boot - No 12.5v
threads.message: Compare <RESISTOR>R7012</RESISTOR> value, measured onboard (ohm scale), with good board.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Charger Green/Orange - No Boot - No 12.5v

<RESISTOR>R7012</RESISTOR> Values

Good Board - 21.8k ohms
